column4: I attempted to get source code for xorg.  I basically got an "about xorg" file.  The file and the terminal msgs are here, if anyne can take a look.  http://pastebin.com/d1c4dd982
I am trying to get the actual code
put the deb-src repos in /etc/apt/sources.list and apt-get source xserver-xorg
well, read 'man apt-get' for exactly what apt-get source does. maybe it's not what you want.
I did as suggested, but got the same response. http://pastebin.com/d1c4dd982  This is the file that downloaded, and my terminal msgs.
you mean it says the file was already downloaded, but it isn't there?
perhaps because xserver-xorg is a metapackage.
try apt-get source x11-common
hmm good thought I will  try that
if i strace xmodmap, no conf files seem to be opened.
i don't think there's any files involved. shame on them if there are, and not mentioned at the bottom of man xmodmap ;)
All I am trying to do is mod the file that assigns values too XF86 buttons
I tried apt-get for x11-common and still get the same terminal msgs
I am gonna try xorg's web site, and launchpad...brb
maybe xserver-xorg-core  (apt-cache search xserver-xorg and look at its dependencies)
I am looking at it now
that'll get you more code than you want ;)
check out the files in /etc/X11 too, maybe. You can snoop around /etc/X11/xkb/* it seems.
I have looked at some, but they were either programs or .so files..neither of which I can open and read, but I'll look some more
there's plenty of *.c in xserver-xorg-core, though i thinking your goal would be better accomplished scanning Xorg (and related) man pages.
Sorry, went downstairs. I will look into that, thank much.
welcome
